name: Sriracha Honey Salmon
author: klhn1986
summary: This is a slightly American take on the sriracha craze sweeping the nation. The honey and soy sauce give a twist to what would be hoisin sauce. The jalapeno and onion go nicely with the sriracha flavor. This dish is some what similar to the flavors that would be added to a bowl of pho. It's inexpensive and easy.
directions: Mix honey, sriracha sauce, sriracha paste, onion, jalapeno pepper, soy sauce, cilantro, and lime juice together in a bowl
Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil
Brush salmon fillets with olive oil; place skin-side up on the lined baking sheet
Broil salmon in the preheated oven until skin is crisp, about 5 minutes
Flip and spread honey mixture over salmon
Continue cooking until salmon flakes easily with a fork, 5 to 10 minutes more
